user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_ConsoleTask_Entry:
```c
static void *OS_ConsoleTask_Entry(void *arg)
{
    OS_VoidPtrValueWrapper_t           local_arg;
    OS_impl_console_internal_record_t *local;
    OS_object_token_t                  token;

    /* cppcheck-suppress unreadVariable // intentional use of other union member */
    local_arg.opaque_arg = arg;
    if (OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_REFCOUNT, OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONSOLE, local_arg.id, &token) == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        local = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_console_table, token);

        /* Loop forever (unless shutdown is set) */
        while (OS_SharedGlobalVars.GlobalState != OS_SHUTDOWN_MAGIC_NUMBER)
        {
            OS_ConsoleOutput_Impl(&token);
            sem_wait(&local->data_sem);
        }
        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }
    return NULL;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_ConsoleTask_Entry:
typedef union
{
    void *           opaque_arg;
    OS_ArgCallback_t arg_callback_func;
    osal_id_t        id;
    osal_index_t     idx;
} OS_VoidPtrValueWrapper_t
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
OS_impl_console_internal_record_t OS_impl_console_table[OS_MAX_CONSOLES]
...
typedef struct
{
    sem_t data_sem;
} OS_impl_console_internal_record_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
extern OS_SharedGlobalVars_t OS_SharedGlobalVars
...
#define OS_SHUTDOWN_MAGIC_NUMBER 0xABADC0DE
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONSOLE 0x0C
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No compiler language extensions are used in the provided code. Specifically:
- No vendor-specific keywords or attributes (for example, no __attribute__, __declspec, typeof, __extension__, __asm__, __builtin_* or similar) are present.
- No nested functions, statement-expressions, or GCC/Clang-specific expression extensions are used.
- The union-based wrapper (OS_VoidPtrValueWrapper_t) and accessing a different union member is standard C (implementation-defined behavior), not a compiler extension; the cppcheck comment is a static-analysis directive, not a language extension.
- The sem_wait call and POSIX APIs are platform libraries, not language extensions.
- The macro OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET and its use are ordinary preprocessor usage, not an extension.
- There are no #pragma directives or other vendor-specific preprocessing extensions.
Therefore there are no code fragments that need investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 (language extensions should not be used).
